(Simplified: 芗)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 鄉 indicates the sound; 艹 (herb) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 鄉 [ xiāng ] country, village; rural
①古書上指用以調味的紫蘇之類的香草。
②同“香”。
薌劇 [ xiāng jù ]: variety of opera popular in southern Fujian and Taiwan
薌城 [ xiāng chéng ]: Xiangcheng district of Zhangzhou city 漳州市 , Fujian
薌城區 [ xiāng chéng qū ]: Xiangcheng district of Zhangzhou city 漳州市 , Fujian

薌字的基本解释

薌
xiāng
见“芗”。

薌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiāng］
［《廣韻》許良切，平陽，曉。］
“芗1”的繁体字。
(1)谷类的香气。参见“薌合”、“薌萁”。
(2)指紫苏之类的香草。古人用以调味。
(3)通“香”。香气。
(4)通“香”。炷香；香火。
[②]［xiǎng］
［《集韻》許兩切，上養，曉。］
“芗2”的繁体字。通“響1”。

薌字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　薌； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1060第29
【唐韻】許良切，音鄕。【說文】穀氣也。【禮·曲禮】黍曰薌合，粱曰薌萁。又【內則】春宜羔豚膳膏薌。【註】牛膏薌，犬膏臊。　又地名。【張衡·南都賦】華薌重秬。【註】華薌，鄕名。　又通香。【荀子·非相篇】芬薌以送之。【史記·滑稽傳】微聞薌澤。　又【集韻】許兩切，通響。【前漢書·揚雄傳】薌呹肹以棍根兮。

考證：〔【前漢·揚雄反騷】薌呹肹以棍根兮。〕　謹照原書改前漢書揚雄傳。
薌字的源字形

字源演变：

字形对比：

薌字的起名意思

指古书上指用以调味的紫苏之类的香草，也指香。

Xiang

Xiang

Xiang
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiāng］
["Guangyun" Xu Liangqie, Pingyang, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "芗1".
(1) The aroma of cereals. See "Xianghe", "Xiangqi".
(2) Refers to vanilla such as perilla. The ancients used it as a seasoning.
(3) Through "fragrance". aroma.
(4) Through "fragrance". Stick incense; incense.
[②]［xiǎng］
["Ji Yun" Xu two cuts, upper raising, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "芗2". Pass "Ring 1".
Xiang
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Chinese Characters] 　芗; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 1060 29
[Tang Yun] Xu Liangqie, the sound is 鄕. [Said the text] Gu Qi also. 【Rituals·Courtesy】Millennium is called Xianghe, and Liang is called Xiangqi. Also 【Inner】Chunyi lamb and pork porridge soup. [Note] Niuyaoxiang, canine creaming bashful.　Also place name. 【Zhang Heng·Nandu Fu】Huaxiang Zhongqi. [Note] Huaxiang, Chinese name.　Fragrant again. [Xunzi·Feixiang Chapter] Fenxiang will give it away. [Historical Records·Funny Biography] Wei Wen Xiangze.　[Jiyun] Xu two cuts, and the sound is heard. [Previous Han Dynasty·Yang Xiong's Biography] Meng Xiao Xi came with sticks. Textual research: [[Previous Han·Yang Xiong's Anti-Sao] Meng Xiao Xi came with a stick. 〕 　 I would like to follow the original book before the revision of the Han Shu Yangxiong Biography.

Name meaning
Refers to herbs such as perilla used for flavoring in ancient books, and also refers to incense.

fragrant smell of grain; aromatic
